medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 39-year-old male, presented with neck pain after a fall from a ladder. He had a 2-year history of hypertension. MRI revealed a C3 vertebral body collapse with an underlying C3 lesion. CT imaging showed multiple lytic skeletal lesions and progressive disease over time, notably enlargement of the right adrenal mass and the aortocaval lymph node conglomerate, which worsened two months after the initial diagnosis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a 2-year history of hypertension.
medical_history.family_history: Family history reveals several relatives with cancer at a young age: sister with stage IV breast cancer at age 22, father with prostate cancer in his 50s, maternal uncle with Hodgkin's lymphoma and prostate cancer, maternal grandfather with colon cancer, a cousin with head and neck cancer at age 6, and another cousin with liver cancer at age 2. medical_history.social_history: The patient had no financial or local social support and moved to another state four months after the initial diagnosis.
